Type: Late Game Push

Each time you summon a Hero (except for the first time) he will receive a random item. Items can combine into many combinations. You can sell last item to free up inventory slots. Heroes get random item every 4 levels and whenever they kill another Hero.

Type: Hero Power / Economy Boost

Reduces spell damage to buildings by 90%.
Has Global Silence and Mana Leak Aura.

Type: Anti Ultimate Weapon

No, seriously, we do hate them!

Type: Anti Hero

Gives: self healing ability
Affects: Vindicator, Artificer and Anchorite

Lv1: heals 150 HP over 15 sec
Lv2: heals 300 HP over 15 sec
Lv3: heals 450 HP over 15 sec
Lv4: heals 600 HP over 15 sec

Gives: hit points and block
Affects: Vindicator

Lv1: +25 HP, 6% to block an attack
Lv2: +50 HP, 12% to block an attack
Lv3: +75 HP, 18% to block an attack
Lv4: +100 HP, 24% to block an attack

Gives: area damage
Affects: Artificer
(slows units for 0.5 sec)

Lv1: 10% to do 25 damage in 150 AoE
Lv2: 20% to do 35 damage in 150 AoE
Lv3: 30% to do 45 damage in 150 AoE
Lv4: 40% to do 55 damage in 150 AoE

Gives: damage ability
Affects: Anchorite

Lv1: 100 damage in 120 AoE
Lv2: 200 damage in 100 AoE
Lv3: 300 damage in 80 AoE
Lv4: 400 damage in 60 AoE

Gives: damage and move speed
Affects: Elekk Rider

Lv1: +50% damage, 30 sec cooldown
Lv2: +75% damage, 25 sec cooldown
Lv3: +100% damage, 20 sec cooldown
Lv4: +125% damage, 15 sec cooldown

Gives: cleaving attack and critical strike

(125 AoE and 1.75x damage)

Lv1: 15% cleave, 10% to crit
Lv2: 25% cleave, 20% to crit
Lv3: 35% cleave, 30% to crit
Lv4: 45% cleave, 40% to crit

Gives: buff dispel and mana burn
Affects: Nether Ray
(does not affect Special unit)

Lv1: can hit 3 units, burns 75 mana
Lv2: can hit 4 units, burns 150 mana
Lv3: can hit 5 units, burns 225 mana
Lv4: can hit 6 units, burns 300 mana

Gives: chance to stun
Affects: Arkonite Lance and Arkonite Pylon
(has half duration on Heroes)

Lv1: 12% for 3 sec stun
Lv2: 24% for 3 sec stun
Lv3: 36% for 3 sec stun
Lv4: 48% for 3 sec stun

(affects organic units only)

Lv4: -24% spell damage

Lordaeron

Units:
+10% attack rate

Buildings:
+1 armor

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Armor

Magic:
Holy Light (100 HP to 1 unit)
Blizzard (90 damage in 225 AoE)
Resurrection (revives 1 unit)

Traits: Jacks of all trades but masters of none. Very basic and simple, but versatile and adaptive. Good in every situation, foolproof and idiotfriendly. Easy to play and very boring. Recomended for total Noobs.

Difficulty: Beginer

Ironforge Dwarf

Units:
+2 armor
-10% attack rate

Buildings:
+10% hit points

Upgrades:
+2Lv Building Armor

Traits: What they lack in magic and spells, Dwarves make it up in their ingenuity. Weak starting units, but powerful late game mechanical contraptions that are resistant to almost all magic effects.

Difficulty: Advanced

Rogue

Units:
-30% buy cost
+200 Artillery attack range
-2 armor

Buildings:
+100 attack range

Upgrades:

Traits: Cheap units with significant battle experience. Trained to fight without any honour and show no mercy. Real soldiers of fortune, relying on acquiring high quality gear on the battlefield.

Worgen

Units:
+10% attack rate

Buildings:
+1 armor

Scarlet Crusade

Units:
+2 armor
-5% evasion

Buildings:

200 minimum Tower and Keep range

Wildhammer Dwarf

Units:
+10% attack rate
-4 armor

Buildings:
+100 attack range
-10% attack rate

Upgrades:
-5% cost

Traits: Wild warriors with primitive weaponry, highly focused on battle rage. Very limited use of magic. Imbues units with power runes instead. Vulnerable to dispels. Has superior air forces.

Difficulty: Skilled

Orc

Units:
+12% damage

Buildings:
+20% damage

Upgrades:
+2Lv Building Armor

Magic:
Bloodlust (+15% attack rate to 1 unit)
Purge (removes buffs from 1 unit)
Chain Lightning (175 damage to 6 units)

Traits: Basic at a first glance, but actually far more tricky to play. Easy to learn, but difficult to master. Very buff and aura dependent race. Augments troop damage output with blind rage and frenzy.

Difficulty: Skilled

Troll

Units:
+5% evasion
-5% hit points

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+3Lv Ranged Weapons

Traits: Why so serious? Come and have a smoke with us! Fragile in early game, unpredictable in late game. Debilitates and confuses enemy. You won't win all games, but you will have fun in every single one.

Difficulty: Skilled

Tauren

Units:
+10% hit points
+1 HP/sec regeneration
-10% attack rate

Buildings:
+20% damage

Upgrades:
+3Lv Melee Weapons

Traits: Slow and steady wins the race! It is not about dealing damage, its about outliving enemy. Damage output rises slowly and peaks in late game. It depends on brute force and so cannot be denied or dispelled.

Difficulty: Advanced

Goblin

Units:
-30% buy cost
-5% hit points

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+3Lv Ranged Weapons

Traits: Goblins have frail little bodies so they have to relay on their wits and more or less powerful mechanical contraptions. And, of course, explosions. Lots and lots and lots of EXPLOSIONS.

Difficulty: Advanced

Pandaren

+5% hit points
3x damage roll interval

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+10% research speed

Traits: Very random and unpredictable chance based commbat skills. Everything is left to the dice roll, nothing depends on you. So just kick back and relax, sip your drink and enjoy the show.

Difficulty: Beginer

Night Elf

+1.5 HP/sec regeneration

Buildings:
+25% HP/sec regeneration

Upgrades:

-12% damage
